fields.name: HIKING WITH GUIDE IN NORTH - Midnight sun
fields.description: Hiking – Midnight sun We travel by minibus and walk about 3-4 km along the mountain Luossavaaras east side. After the path up to the mountain there is much to see and experience in terms of nature (flora, fauna, geology), history of the mine and facts about the future of the city. On the top we have the best view to see the midnight sun, there we enjoy a cup of coffee/tea and a lovely reindeer meat sandwich and for dessert a delicious homemade Kiruna Sunset Cake with cream and cloudberries.
fields.note: Evening time is quite cold, please take a warm jacket

fields.name: NATURE GUIDE – FOREST BATH
fields.description: A short hike in the forest and mountains where we experience nature with all our senses. Today, many people feel stressed and we are constantly exposed to noisy environments. The forest and the mountains provide tranquility, joy and well-being. Maybe you will hear the sound of rippling water, the buzzing wind, the chirping of birds, the memory of sounds that are deeply rooted in our genes from the time humans were collectors and hunters. During the tour you will receive guidance and tools to see nature just as it is, part of you.
fields.included: Transfer, guide, coffee/tea, sandwich with reindeer meat, cookies
fields.meeting_place: We will pick-up you 10:00 at your hotel

fields.name: MIDNIGHT SUN TOUR ON HORSEBACK
fields.description: The evening starts at our horse farm in Puoltsa, you can either go here on your own or book a transfer. We prepare the horses together and ride on a tour in the forest around Puoltsa. We ride a bit higher up and stay for coffee. Hopefully, it's clear weather so we'll see the midnight sun. We will return to the farm after midnight.
fields.note: Max weight 90 kg and minimum age 12 years

fields.name: SLEDDOG KENNEL VISIT AND SHORT CART RIDE
fields.description: The evening starts at our horse farm in Puoltsa, you can either go here on your own or book a transfer. We prepare the horses together and ride on a tour in the forest around Puoltsa. We ride a bit higher up and stay for coffee. Hopefully, it's clear weather so we'll see the midnight sun. We will return to the farm after midnight.
fields.included: Transfer, coffee/tea and cookies, guide, short cart ride.

fields.name: ENTRANCE TO ICEHOTEL WITH GUIDED TOUR
fields.description: The story of Icehotel starts in 1989, when it became the world's first and largest hotel made of ice and snow. It's also Sweden's most unique and probably most extensive private art hall. Each year it's reincarnated in a new guise, carefully designed and handcrafted by some 40 artists from around the world. In Icehotel 365 you are able to experience the new permanent ice art hall.housing nine Deluxe Suites, each with its own bathroom and sauna, as well as eleven Art Suites. The structure also holds a magnificent ICEBAR that serves champagne and drinks, and an ice gallery. All of it created out of ice and snow by hand-picked artist from around the globe, according to the same concept as the classic Icehotel. The temperature is -5 C (23 F) year round and the refrigeration unit that keeps Icehotel 365 cold during the summer runs on energy from a 875 m2 solar cell facility.
fields.note: Buy your entry tickets at the warm reception, Riverside Lobby, or at the counter in Icehotel Shop. Guided tours are complimentary to overnight guests to Icehotel.

fields.name: A CITY IN MOTION – THE GUIDED TOUR
fields.description: The city of Kiruna is transforming in many ways when the big iron ore mine is going deeper. The oldest parts of town will disappear and historic buildings will have to move. Environments and houses will be moved or torn down. People and businesses are being effected.
fields.included: Guided tour by minibus, city tour in actual areas, Whispers-receiver so the guests can hear our guide all the time. Exhibition/slide show. Coffee/tea and sandwich (raw spiced salmon or smoked reindeer). Mineral water.

fields.name: NIGHTLY AURORA PHOTO TOURS IN ABISKO NATIONAL PARK
fields.description: Join one of Lights Over Lapland’s professional photographers for an opportunity to see and photograph the aurora borealis in the wilderness of Abisko National Park. Due to clear skies and virtually no light pollution Abisko is one of the greatest places in the world to see the northern lights. We will provide you with a high-quality camera and lens and quickly teach you the skills that you will need to find and photograph the magical aurora borealis. Even if you have never used a camera before you have an extremely high chance of going home with beautiful aurora photographs and memories that will last a lifetime! Small groups ensure a very personal and genuine experience. Trips are available from October until the end of March. During our Nightly Aurora Photo Tours we will visit one of our beautiful locations in Abisko National Park including the Lights Over Lapland teepee, Abisko’s world famous Sami camp, the frozen surface of Lake Torneträsk or the peaceful Abisko River Delta.
fields.included: Camera, tripod, backpack, warm overalls, head lamp, warm drink, guiding services and approximately three hours of searching for and photographing the auroras in Abisko National Park.
fields.meeting_place: Abisko Mountain Lodge for tours on October 1st to November 18th / STF Abisko Turiststation for tours on November 19th to March 31st.
fields.note: Please bring a SD memory card to use in our cameras. We recommend a minimum of 4 GB. 16 GB memory cards can be purchased on spot to a cost of 200 SEK. It is important that you bring warm clothes to wear under your overalls and warm insulated winter boots for your feet. Warm boots are also available for rent (100 SEK). Minimum age: 10 years old. Children under 15 years old will share a camera with an adult.

fields.name: GUOVSSAHASAT – REINDEER & NORTHERN LIGHTS
fields.description: A magic night with reindeer, silence and hopefully the Northern lights – a well-known phenomenon in Sámi mythology. We will take you to a small Sámi village on the road to Norway. Far away from the city lights we’ll make an outing into the dark and wintry countryside. Your guide will drive the snowmobile while you relax in the sled watching the awesome sky, trying to spot the Aurora borealis. We’ll make several stops and enjoy the silence and the darkness. It has to be dark and relatively clear – and you also need some luck. Even without the Aurora it is a nature experience! During this tour you will hear many stories with regard to Sámi mythology and history. You will always encounter some reindeer and be able to feed them with your own hands. At the end of the tour we’ll relax around the fire in a Sámi tepee (lavvu) and enjoy a warm meal and coffee or tea. If we haven’t seen the Northern lights, there’s still a chance before we return to Kiruna.
fields.included: Transfer, guide, warm clothing, evening meal
fields.meeting_place: Your hotel in Kiruna C or the tourist office in Kiruna
fields.note: Please tell us beforehand if you don’t eat meat.

fields.name: HIGH MOUNTAIN OVERNIGHT TOUR WITH SNOWMOBILE
fields.description: We go by minibus to Nikkaluokta. We change over to snowmobile and drive up to the mountain lake Láddjujávri. Around us we have high steep mountains and in front of us we have the highest mountain in Sweden, Kebnekaise. We are most likely to see several moose during our trip. We will try some icefishing on the frozen lake. The cabin where we will spend the night has toilet and shower. In the evening you can enjoy a sauna and dinner. After breakfast next morning we will get on the snowmobiles and head back towards Nikkaluokta and Kiruna.
fields.included: Guide, winter clothing (boots, winter overalls, thick gloves, helmet), full board, towel/bed sheets, transfer
fields.not_included: Pick-up from a hotel costs 150 SEK/person, 75 SEK/Child (up to 12 years)
fields.meeting_place: Daily at 09.00 am at the Tourist Office in Kiruna. Pick-up from Ice Hotel in Jukkasjärvi will be 30 min. before the tour begins, at 8.30!
fields.note: You must have a valid driving license to drive a snowmobile. Persons without a license can ride on the back with someone else or with the guide. Small children will be pulled in a sled behind the guide.

fields.name: SKI SCHOOL AT LUOSSAVAARA SKI HILL
fields.departure_date: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday
fields.description: Join us on the smooth slopes of our local mountain Luossavaara with a breathtaking view of our beautiful city and the mining mountain Kirunavaara. We will enjoy a great afternoon/evening together to challenge our skill in making our way down the slope with fabulous turns! This is a fun and challenging experience together with us at the ski school. We are all here for you who wants to try downhill skiing for the first time or further develop your skills and advance a little more. Naturally we adapt our classes according to your previous experience and skill.
fields.not_included: Equipment: (skis, boots, poles, helmet) can all be hired at the café at the base of the ski hill. 400 SEK, Transfer
fields.meeting_place: Your hotel in Kiruna City or Luossavaara Ski Hill
fields.note: We can pick you up at your hotel in Kiruna City, just call +46 702701402 (cost 100 SEK) or you can take a taxi to Luossavaara Ski Hill.

fields.name: GUIDED TOUR ICEHOTEL
fields.description: We start by visiting the Icehotel, where you can see the fantastic sculptures and the ice rooms in peace on your own. We’re visiting the “Sámi Church” from 1607, which is log timbered and completely built in wood. The interior has a distinct sámi touch and even the church organ is ornated in the beautiful sámi craft tradition – known as “duoddji”. The Old Homestay with its atmosphere and old timber houses – the oldest from 1768 – gives an impression of the early settlers lifestyle in this arctic environment, and the interaction with the sámi people and their culture. The tour ends with a visit at Nutti Sami Siida. Here is the somewhat different Café Sápmi  – a large lávvu (a sami form af tipi) with an open fire inside and comfortable rustic benches. This is a nice place for a hot drink (and/or a cold) drink and piece of pastry of your choice. After this we will head back for Camp Ripan.
fields.included: transfer, entrance Icehotel, guide, warm/cold beverages and pastry at Café Sápmi, warm clothes, booster seat for children
fields.meeting_place: 09:30 am at Camp Ripan, 09:15 am other hostels.
fields.note: Drop-off: Camp Ripan 12:30 am. On request: Kiruna Airport 12:15 am

fields.name: INTERACT WITH THE LOCAL CULTURE – GET TO KNOW THE SÁMI CULTURE
fields.description: We start with a step into the Sámi culture and a visit to the Sámi museum. Travelling back thousands of years to take a look at the traditional clothes and tools that were, and are vital, to living in the cold of daily life in the Arctic. Next we gather around the sparkling fire in the Lávvu, the traditional Sámi place to live within nature. Here the journey begins around eight seasons, our life. To be together, young and old, working together and learning from our elders. We are helping each other.
fields.included: Coffee/tea + Taste of Sápmi – reindeer broth, arctic char, dried & salted reindeer meat, berryshots (Lingon, Blueberry and crowberry) and traditional sámi flatbread
fields.meeting_place: Jukkasjärvi at The old Homestead, at 12:00
fields.note: Extras: Guided tour from Kiruna to Jukkasjärvi 300 SEK/person

fields.name: KIRUNA HUSKY DAYTOUR – BE A MUSHER
fields.description: On the Be a musher tour you have the opportunity to drive your own dog sled team instead of sitting on the big sled. Taking turns during the tour gives you the chance to feel like a real Musher and also to take pictures when sitting on the dog sled as a passenger. We give you detailed instructions for controlling the dog sled and the husky team. The guides will be nearby during the tour and are available to help you out if necessary. In daylight we can take pictures and in good weather conditions we can see the mountains to the west. On this husky tour we have lunch together around a warming fireplace. Here we can cuddle our dogs and get to know them better.
fields.included: winter clothing (winter overalls, boots, mittens, hats, head lights), lunch and transfer from Kiruna
fields.note: Equipment recommended: warm underwear, face masks, warm clothes. Available German.

fields.name: ECOTOURS – WILDERNESS TOUR
fields.description: Follow a biologist by minivan to the west of Kiruna! Experience spectacular views towards the highest mountains and an unspoiled river! Moose, reindeer, hare, fox, otter and their tracks can be seen, together with some very specialized birds. How can they survive in these Arctic conditions? We will also feed birds and study their behavior. Some of these birds are only seen in the northern forests. A small payback to the birds and nature is given for every tour! One birdhouse is set out in a nice place by the participants. We also enjoy ”fika”, with warm drinks and traditional cookies.
fields.included: A local guide in Arctic ecology, Extra clothing, shoes and binoculars, Fike (Coffee time)
fields.meeting_place: Pickup at your hotel in Kiruna C

fields.name: RÁIDU – ENCOUNTER WITH REINDEER
fields.description: Come and experience traditional Sámi lifestyle and the art of reindeer sledding with our dedicated guides in Jukkasjärvi. Help train, feed and race reindeer while learning about the importance these beautiful animals have to the Sámi way of life. Travel in a snowmobile-drawn sled through woods draped with hanging lichen and clad in snow to the Sautosjohka reindeer enclosure outside Jukkasjärvi, a winter camp that we use for reindeer husbandry.
fields.meeting_place: 13.00 Kiruna hotels/Tourist Center, 13.30 Icehotel, 13.45 Reindeer Lodge.
fields.note: DROP-OFF: Appr. 17.20 Icehotel, 17.30 Reindeer Lodge, 17.45 Kiruna hotels/Tourist Center and 18.00 Kiruna train station.

fields.name: TRADITIONAL SAMI COOKING
fields.description: Welcome to a journey in the world of the senses of the Sami cuisine where you can cook and eat a meal with traditional food from Sápmi. It is a taste of the traditional food and culture, based on a long experience of taking advantage of what nature offers. Baking gáhkku (Sami traditional bread) over an open fire, produce the special coffee cheese and cooking meat are some of the things you will learn during the day and you get the chance to taste other Sami food also. Around the fire in the goahti (sami hut) we talk about Sami food, culture and way of relating to nature and animals. There we also eat our own cooked meal.
fields.meeting_place: We pick you up in Kiruna
fields.note: You don't need any special knowledge of cooking! / The original price was 1950 SEK.

fields.name: DOGSLEDDING WITH COFFEE AND LUNCH
fields.description: In our beautiful winter wonderland you may very well see reindeer and moose roaming freely in the wonderful snow covered forests as well as p'tarmigan, capercaillie and siberian jay roaming the skies. Our experienced guides will introduce you to the dogs and you will have the opportunity to take many wonderful pictures. We stop halfway at our warm wilderness cabin for a 'Fika' before returning across expansive and often spectacular frozen lakes. On our lunch tour you can choose to drive your own team of huskies. You and your Husky team will travel through forest sections often covered in beautiful shining snow and across frozen rivers and lakes. We take a lunch break to enjoy some local traditional cusine of reindeer soup before setting of into the sunset with your enthusiatic team of Alaskan Huskies.
fields.included: guide, transfer, warm clothes, coffee/tea & cookie, lunch tour, driving your own team of huskies.

fields.name: DINNER WITH A TASTE OF SWEDISH LAPLAND
fields.description: Our chef invites you to an unforgettable evening in a unique environment. The evening´s menu is inspired by the age old Sámi traditional recipes and spiced with new twists and influences from around the world. We start the dinner in the Northern Light room with a slideshow that depicts the story of a year in the life of a young Sámi girl, Katarina Poggats Sarri, together with her family. You will have a glimpse into how the Sámi people live in today´s modern society.
fields.included: Four course meal, welcome drink and Sámi slideshow.
